description: Triangle of coefficients in expansion of (1+5x)^n.
comments: Mirror image of A038243. - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Nov 25 2007T(n,k) equals the number of n-length words on {0,1,...,5} having n-k zeros. - _Milan Janjic_, Jul 24 2015
links: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
formula: G.f.: 1 / [1 - x(1+5y)].T(n,k) = 5^k*C(n,k) = Sum_{i=n-k..n} C(i,n-k) *C(n,i) *4^(n-i). Row sums are 6^n = A000400(n). - _Mircea Merca_, Apr 28 2012
maple: T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, k), k=0..n))((1+5*x)^n):seq(T(n), n=0..10);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 10 2014
mathematica: row[n_] := CoefficientList[(1 + 5x)^n, x]; Table[row[n], {n, 0, 9}] // Flatten (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Feb 13 2016 *)
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
